text: Among the 47 patients who took antibiotics before hospitalization, 17 (14.4%) received Amoxicillin, 8 (5.6%) Ceftriaxone, 4 (2.8%) Amoxicillin/Clavulanic acid, and 3 (2.1%) Cotrimoxazole. Among the 63 cases tested for antibiotic detection testing in urine, 22 (65.1%) were positive; in this population, sensitivity of declared antibiotic use compared with urine detection was low (sensitivity = 51.2%, 95% confidence interval: 35.1-67.1%).
